intro: Hieracium candicans, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flowers with a distinctive white center, surrounded by ray florets. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Hieracium candicans is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and serrated leaves.
